THE SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (SEPTA) INTENDS TO USE THESE FUNDS FOR THE FY 2015 NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM WITHIN THE PHILADELPHIA PENNSYLVANIA URBANIZED AREA. SPECIFICALLY SEPTA INTENDS TO USE THESE FUNDS FOR SEPTAS RACE-VINE STATION ADA ACCESSIBILITY PROJECT SUBRECIPIENT MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS AND ADMINISTRATION ACTIVITIES FOR BOTH SEPTA AND SUBRECIPIENTS. THE PROJECT SPONSORS INCLUDE THREE NON-PROFIT SUBRECIPIENTS AND ONE PUBLIC PROJECT SPONSOR (SEPTA). ALL OF THE PROJECTS IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS SERVE URBAN AREAS. THIS GRANT UTILIZES $1344569 IN SECTION 5317 NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE PHILADELPHIA PA-NJ-DE-MD URBANIZED AREA IN FEDERAL FY 2012. IN URBANIZED AREAS OVER 200000 IN POPULATION THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT IS CHARGED WITH ADMINISTERING THE NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM. THIS INCLUDES APPLYING DIRECTLY TO FTA FOR A NEW FREEDOM GRANT FOR ITSELF AND ON BEHALF OF SUBRECIPIENTS. THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF NEW FREEDOM FUNDS IN THE PHILADELPHIA URBANIZED AREA IS SEPTA.THESE PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION MPO COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN DATED MAY 2007.THESE PROJECTS WERE COMPETITIVELY SELECTED BY THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION ON MAY 23 2013 THROUGH THE PROCESS DEVELOPED FOR NEW FREEDOM FUNDING APPORTIONED TO THE PHILADELPHIA PA-DE-NJ-MD URBANIZED AREA. THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPROVED THE FY 2014 NEW FREEDOM PROJECTS ON SEPTEMBER 26 2013.THE LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA.BUDGET REVISION #3 (JUNE 2021): THIS BUDGET REVISION WILL MODIFY THE AWARD BUDGET TO REFLECT ACTUAL PROJECT EXPENSES. AWARD WILL BE CLOSED ONCE BUDGET REVISION IS APPROVED AND PROJECT CLOSEOUT ACTIVITIES ARE COMPLETE.

FY 2012 NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM (SECTION 5317)CATALOG OF FEDERAL DOMESTIC ASSISTANCE (CFDA) NUMBER- 20.521GRANT APPLICATION SUMMARYNJ TRANSIT IS REQUESTING FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IN THE AMOUNT OF $3010296 OF NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM FUNDS UNDER 49 U.S.C 5317 ALLOCATED TO NEW JERSEY. FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2709268 WILL BE MATCHED BY THE LOCAL SUBRECIPIENTS WITH NON-USDOT FUNDS. FEDERAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT/CAPITAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1286327 WILL HAVE AN 80/20 MATCH OF $321583. FEDERAL OPERATING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1422941 WILL HAVE A 50/50 MATCH (OPERATING MATCH IS $1422941). PROJECT ADMINISTRATION $301028 WILL BE FUNDED AT 100 PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE AS ALLOWED UNDER NEW FREEDOM GUIDANCE CHAPTER III GENERAL PROGRAM INFORMATION 10. RECIPIENT ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. THE MATCH WILL TOTAL $1744524 ($1422941 OPERATING MATCH AND $321583 MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND CAPITAL EQUIPMENT MATCH).FUNDING WILL SUPPORT TWENTY-THREE (23) NEW FREEDOM PROJECTS THAT PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TOOLS AND PARATRANSIT SERVICES FOR DISABLED RESIDENTS SEEKING INTEGRATION INTO THE WORKFORCE AND FULL PARTICIPATION IN SOCIETY. THESE PROJECTS ARE IN ALL THREE OF NEW JERSEYS MPO REGIONS: NJTPA (13 PROJECTS) DVRPC (6 PROJECTS) AND SJTPO (4 PROJECTS). ALL OF THE PROJECTS SELECTED ARE DERIVED FROM A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLANS. ALL OF THE PROJECTS PROVIDE NEW PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (OR CONTINUATION OF PRIOR YEARS APPROVED NEW FREEDOM SERVICES) AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES BEYOND THOSE REQUIRED BY THE ADA FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN BOTH RURAL AND URBANIZED AREAS. ELEVEN (11) SELECTED PROJECTS ARE CONTINUATION/EXPANSIONS OF OPERATING PROJECTS FROM FFY 2009 2010 AND 2011. CONTINUATION PROJECTS INCLUDE: BERGEN DR MEADOWLINK BERGEN HUDSON SHUTTLE; MIDDLESEX COUNTY EMPLOYMENT SHUTTLES; OCEAN COUNTY BRICK LINK DR/SHUTTLE; SENIOR CITIZENS UNITED COMMUNITY SERVICES OF CAMDEN COUNTY (SCUCS) PARATRANSIT EMPLOYMENT DR SERVICES; SUSSEX COUNTY SKYLANDS RIDE TO WORK DR CONNECTION; WARREN COUNTY DR SERVICE; GLOUCESTER COUNTY DR SERVICE; SALEM COUNTY PEARL TRANSIT (SALEM COUNTY) WAY2WORK DR SERVICE; AND SALEM COUNTY DR SERVICES. MEADOWLINK WILL EXPAND ITS FFY 2010/11 FLEX T SERVICE TO INCLUDE 6 COUNTIES IN NORTHERN NJ.FIVE (5) SELECTED PROJECTS ARE CONTINUATION/EXPANSIONS OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT/TRAVEL TRAINING PROJECTS FROM FFY 2009 2010 AND 2011. CONTINUATIONS OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS INCLUDE: BERGEN COUNTY SALEM COUNTY; ATLANTIC COUNTY; AND MERCER TMA MOBILITY MANAGEMENT. NJTIP RUTGERS WILL EXPAND ITS TRAVEL TRAINING SERVICES TO INCLUDE 6 COUNTIES IN NORTHERN NJ (NJTPA AREA).TWO (2) SELECTED PROJECTS REQUEST VEHICLES TO REPLACE AND EXPAND EXISTING PROJECTS BERGEN COUNTY (1 VEHICLE) AND MEADOWLINK FLEX T (5 VEHICLES). TWO (2) NEW OPERATING PROJECTS SELECTED INCLUDE: RIDE WISE TMA DEMAND RESPONSE (SOMERSET COUNTY) AND ARC MERCER DR EVENING AND WEEKEND SERVICE. THREE (3) NEW MOBILITY MANAGEMENT/TRAVEL TRAINING PROJECTS SELECTED INCLUDE: MOBILITY MANAGEMENT : MEADOWLINK MOBILITY MANAGEMENT (FLEX-T) AND UNION ORGANIZATION FOR SOCIAL SERVICE (CAMDEN COUNTY); AND TRAVEL TRAINING RUTGERS NJ TIP TRAVEL TRAINING IN CENTRAL NEW JERSEY (DVRPC AREA).APPLICANTS NOT APPROVED FOR FUNDING DUE TO INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS AND LACK OF FUNDS TO SUPPORT THEIR PROJECTS INCLUDE: BRIGHT MINDS (TRAVEL TRAINING UN URBAN NJTPA URBAN AREA) PEARL TRANSIT (OPERATIONS IN SMALL URBAN/NON URBAN DVRPC AREA) AND ARC MERCER (3 VEHICLES AND SOFTWARE IN URBAN DVRPC AREA).CATEGORY A - $3010296. PROJECT ADMINISTRATION - $301028.TOTAL: $4754820 (CATEGORY A $3010296 + $1744524 MATCH). COORDINATION AND PLANNINGAS REQUIRED BY TITLE 49 U.S.C. 5317 AS AMENDED BY SAFETEA-LU THE TWENTY-THREE (23) PROJECTS SELECTED FOR FUNDING UNDER THE NEW FREEDOM (SECTION 5317) PROGRAM ARE DERIVED FROM LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLANS. THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED BY THIS GRANT APPLICATION WERE DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLAN (CHSTP) DEVELOPED BY THE THREE NEW JERSEY METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS (MPOS): THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (DVRPC); THE NORTH JERSEY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AUTHORITY (NJTPA) AND THE SOUTH JERSEY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ORGANIZATION (SJTPO).EACH COUNTY ADOPTED ITS OWN INDIVIDUAL COUNTY PLAN. THE CHSTP WAS THEN PREPARED THROUGH AN OPEN COORDINATED PROCESS IN ALL THREE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS (MPOS) THAT COVER THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY FULLY ENGAGING LOCAL AND STATE STAKEHOLDERS IN THE PROCESS OF ASSESSING CURRENT CONDITIONS THROUGH TO AND INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF RECOMMENDATIONS. THE THREE MPOS ADOPTED THEIR RESPECTIVE COUNTIES COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS. THOSE MPOS WERE THE NORTH JERSEY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AUTHORITY (NJTPA) THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (DVRPC) AND THE SOUTH JERSEY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ORGANIZATION (SJTPO). THE NJTPA COVERS THE THIRTEEN (13) NORTHERN-MOST COUNTIES IN NEW JERSEY: BERGEN ESSEX HUDSON HUNTERDON MIDDLESEX MONMOUTH MORRIS OCEAN PASSAIC SOMERSET SUSSEX UNION AND WARREN. A CONSULTANT FOR THE NJTPA UPDATES ITS REGIONAL PLAN FOR THE 13 COUNTIES IN THE NORTHERN PART OF THE STATE AND PUBLISHED A REPORT IN JUNE 2008. THE PLAN WAS DEVELOPED WITH THE INPUT OF PUBLIC NON-PROFIT AND PRIVATE TRANSPORTATION STAKEHOLDERS WHO ARE INVOLVED IN HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION.THE BI-STATE MPO DVRPC COVERS THE FOUR (4) COUNTIES OF MERCER BURLINGTON CAMDEN AND GLOUCESTER. DVRPC UPDATED AND APPROVED ITS IMPROVING ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES IN THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGION: COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN IN MAY 2007. DVRPC INCORPORATED ALL REVIEW COMMENTS RECEIVED THROUGH FOCUS GROUPS SUBCOMMITTEE MEETINGS AND PUBLIC HEARINGS. THE DVRPC AREA PLAN WAS UPDATED AND AMENDED IN DECEMBER 2010. THE SJTPO COVERS THE FOUR (4) SOUTHERN-MOST COUNTIES OF ATLANTIC CAPE MAY CUMBERLAND AND SALEM WHICH ADOPTED FOUR COUNTY SPECIFIC HUMAN SERVICES PLANS. EACH APPROVED COUNTY PLAN IS AVAILABLE ON THE SJTPO WEBSITE AND REFLECTS THE PROCESS AND SELF-ASSESSMENT WITH STAKEHOLDERS THAT EACH COUNTY CONDUCTED TO COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS. EACH COUNTY CONDUCTED THE COMMUNITY SELF ASSESSMENT A REQUIRED ELEMENT OF THE HUMAN SERVICE COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION PLAN WHICH PROVIDES A PROCESS FOR INVOLVING LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS AND THE PUBLIC IN THE PROCESS OF ASSESSING AND ULTIMATELY COMPILING RECOMMENDATIONS TO ADVANCE COORDINATION. FUNDS WERE REQUESTED AND ALLOCATED VIA NJ-57-X001 FOR THE MPO TO HIRE A CONSULTANT TO UPDATE ITS REGIONAL COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. THE PLAN UPDATE WAS COMPLETED IN 2010. THE CHSTPS WERE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) ON APRIL 2 2008.PUBLIC NOTICETHIS PROJECT WAS PUBLISHED IN NJ TRANSITS FEDERAL PROGRAM PUBLIC NOTICE WHICH WAS PUBLISHED 4/11/13 4/12/13. 4/17/13 4/19/13 4/25/13 5/1/13 5/2/13 5/3/13 AND 5/9/13.STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN/PROJECT MANAGEMENT PLANNJ TRANSIT USED THE PROCEDURES SET FORTH IN THE NEW FREEDOM SMP/PMP FOR SELECTING PROJECTS. PROJECT DESCRIPTIONTHE FUNDING REQUESTED FOR THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT CONTINUATION OF SHUTTLE SERVICES DESIGNED TO ASSIST RESIDENTS IN REACHING EMPLOYMENT TRAINING EDUCATIONAL AND SERVICE CENTERS. FOR EXAMPLE THE PROJECT WOULD LINK EXISTING PUBLIC TRANSIT FACILITIES WITH SITES LIKE THE REGIONAL CENTER FOR DISABILITY EMPLOYMENT AT THE BERGEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE CAMPUS AND THE MEADOWLANDS CORPORATE CENTER IN LYNDHURST. THE CENTER SUPPORTS WORKERS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT THE TRI-COUNTY REGION BY PROVIDING EXTENSIVE JOB TRAINING AND PLACEMENT OPPORTUNITIES. THESE SERVICES WILL OPERATE AS ROUTE DEVIATION SERVICES FEEDING MAJOR TRANSIT HUBS IN THE AREA DURING PEAK HOURS (6 AM TO 9:30 AM AND 4 PM TO 8 PM) 5 DAYS/WEEK. DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE WILL ALSO OPERATE AS NEEDED ON OFF PEAK HOURS TO ASSIST DISABLED INDIVIDUALS ACCESS THE SCHOOL AND OTHER EMPLOYMENT/SERVICE SITES. IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR THE DISABLED POPULATION IT IS EXPECTED THAT ABLE-BODIED COMMUTERS COULD ALSO UTILIZE THIS SHUTTLE SERVICE TO REACH EMPLOYMENT IN THE AREA. ONE SHUTTLE LINKS THE EXTENSIVE BUS SERVICE ON THE RT. 3 CORRIDOR WITH THE LYNDHURST CAMPUS OF BERGEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE (THE REGIONAL CENTER) AS WELL AS WITH OTHER EMPLOYMENT SITES IN THE MEADOWLANDS CORPORATE CENTER WHERE THE COLLEGE IS LOCATED. ANOTHER SHUTTLE LINKS RAIL COMMUTERS COMING FROM RUTHERFORD (ALONG THE MAIN-BERGEN RAIL LINE) WOOD-RIDGE (ALONG THE PASCACK VALLEY RAIL LINE) AND/OR SECAUCUS JUNCTION (A TRANSFER STATION OFFERING CONNECTIONS TO ALMOST ALL OF NJ TRANSITS RAIL LINES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE RARITAN VALLEY RAIL LINE AND THE ATLANTIC CITY RAIL LINE) TO THE LYNDHURST BERGEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE SITE AS WELL AS TO RTS. 17 120 EMPLOYMENT CORRIDORS IN CARLSTADT AND MOONACHIE. APPROXIMATELY 90 TRIPS/MONTH AND $36.49/TRIP. PROJECT DESCRIPTIONTHE FUNDING REQUESTED FOR THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE CONTINUATION OF DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE FOR DISABLED RESIDENTS. INITIATED IN MONMOUTH COUNTY IN 2008 THIS PROJECT CONTINUES TO EXPAND COVERING THE SIX COUNTY AREAS OF BERGEN ESSEX HUDSON PASSAIC MONMOUTH AND UNION COUNTIES. IN A SPIRIT OF UNITED WE RIDE OTHER EMPLOYEES LIKE OLDER ADULTS AND WELFARE CLIENTS MAY ALSO ACCESS THESE SERVICES. A FLEET OF VEHICLES (APPROXIMATELY 20-25) WITH PAID AND VOLUNTEER DRIVERS WOULD BE USED TO SERVE PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES (APPROXIMATELY 150-200 ON A DAILY BASIS) WHO HAVE LITTLE OR NO TRANSIT OPTIONS. MOST EXISTING COUNTY PARATRANSIT SYSTEMS DO NOT CROSS COUNTY LINES OR DO SO ON A VERY LIMITED BASIS. BY CROSSING COUNTY LINES THIS SERVICE OPENS UP AN ARRAY OF EMPLOYMENT PROSPECTS AND LIFE ENHANCING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. COORDINATION AND PLANNINGAS REQUIRED BY TITLE 49 U.S.C. 5317 AS AMENDED BY SAFETEA-LU THE TWENTY-ONE PROJECTS SELECTED FOR FUNDING UNDER THE NEW FREEDOM (SECTION 5317) PROGRAM ARE DERIVED FROM LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLANS. THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED BY THIS GRANT APPLICATION WERE DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLANS (CHSTP) DEVELOPED BY THE THREE NEW JERSEY METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS (MPOS): THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (DVRPC); THE NORTH JERSEY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AUTHORITY (NJTPA) AND THE SOUTH JERSEY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ORGANIZATION (SJTPO).EACH COUNTY ADOPTED ITS OWN INDIVIDUAL COUNTY PLAN. THE CHSTP WAS THEN PREPARED THROUGH AN OPEN COORDINATED PROCESS IN ALL THREE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS (MPOS) THAT COVER THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY FULLY ENGAGING LOCAL AND STATE STAKEHOLDERS IN THE PROCESS OF ASSESSING CURRENT CONDITIONS THROUGH TO AND INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF RECOMMENDATIONS. TWO OF THE THREE MPOS THEN ADOPTED THEIR RESPECTIVE COUNTIES COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS. THOSE MPOS WERE THE NORTH JERSEY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AUTHORITY (NJTPA) AND THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (DVRPC). THE THIRD MPO REQUESTED AND WAS APPROVED FOR NEW FREEDOM FUNDS IN AN EARLIER GRANT APPLICATION (NJ-57-X001) TO HIRE A CONSULTANT TO DEVELOP ITS REGIONAL COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. THE SJTPO AREA PLAN WAS UPDATED AND AMENDED IN DECEMBER 2010. THE NJTPA COVERS THE THIRTEEN NORTHERNMOST COUNTIES IN NEW JERSEY: BERGEN ESSEX HUDSON HUNTERDON MIDDLESEX MONMOUTH MORRIS OCEAN PASSAIC SOMERSET SUSSEX UNION AND WARREN. A CONSULTANT FOR THE NJTPA UPDATES ITS REGIONAL PLAN FOR THE 13 COUNTIES IN THE NORTHERN PART OF THE STATE AND PUBLISHED A REPORT IN JUNE 2008. THE PLAN WAS DEVELOPED WITH THE INPUT OF PUBLIC NON-PROFIT AND PRIVATE TRANSPORTATION STAKEHOLDERS WHO ARE INVOLVED IN HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION.THE BI-STATE MPO DVRPC COVERS THE FOUR COUNTIES OF MERCER BURLINGTON CAMDEN AND GLOUCESTER COUNTIES. DVRPC UPDATED AND APPROVED ITS IMPROVING ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES IN THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGION: COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN IN MAY 2007. DVRPC INCORPORATED ALL REVIEW COMMENTS RECEIVED THROUGH FOCUS GROUPS SUBCOMMITTEE MEETINGS AND PUBLIC HEARINGS. THE DVRPC AREA PLAN WAS UPDATED AND AMENDED IN DECEMBER 2010. SJTPO COVERING THE FOUR SOUTHERN-MOST COUNTIES ATLANTIC CAPE MAY CUMBERLAND AND SALEM ADOPTED FOUR COUNTY SPECIFIC HUMAN SERVICES PLANS. EACH APPROVED COUNTY PLAN IS AVAILABLE ON THE SJTPO WEBSITE AND REFLECTS THE PROCESS AND SELF-ASSESSMENT WITH STAKEHOLDERS THAT EACH COUNTY CONDUCTED TO COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS. EACH COUNTY CONDUCTED THE COMMUNITY SELF ASSESSMENT A REQUIRED ELEMENT OF THE HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLAN WHICH PROVIDES A PROCESS FOR INVOLVING LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS AND THE PUBLIC IN THE PROCESS OF ASSESSING AND ULTIMATELY COMPILING RECOMMENDATIONS TO ADVANCE COORDINATION. FUNDS WERE REQUESTED AND ALLOCATED VIA NJ-57-X001 FOR THE MPO TO HIRE A CONSULTANT TO UPDATE ITS REGIONAL COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. FUNDS REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE SUBSIDIZING THE CONTINUATION OF ROUTE DEVIATION SHUTTLE SERVICES DESIGNED TO ASSIST RESIDENTS IN REACHING EMPLOYMENT TRAINING EDUCATIONAL AND SERVICE CENTERS. SUCH CENTERS INCLUDE THE REGIONAL CENTER FOR DISABILITY EMPLOYMENT LOCATED AT THE BERGEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE IN THE MEADOWLANDS CORPORATE CENTER IN LYNDHURST. DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED AS NEEDED. PROJECT DESCRIPTIONTHE FUNDING REQUESTED FOR THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT CONTINUATION OF SHUTTLE SERVICES DESIGNED TO LINK EXISTING PUBLIC TRANSIT FACILITIES WITH SITES LIKE THE REGIONAL CENTER FOR DISABILITY EMPLOYMENT AT THE BERGEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE CAMPUS IN LYNDHURST. THE CENTER SUPPORTS WORKERS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT THE TRI-COUNTY REGION BY PROVIDING EXTENSIVE JOB TRAINING AND PLACEMENT OPPORTUNITIES. THESE SERVICES WILL OPERATE AS ROUTE DEVIATION SERVICES FEEDING MAJOR TRANSIT HUBS IN THE AREA DURING PEAK HOURS (6 AM TO 9:30 AM AND 4 PM TO 8 PM) 5 DAYS/WEEK. DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE WILL ALSO OPERATE AS NEEDED ON OFF PEAK HOURS TO ASSIST DISABLED INDIVIDUALS ACCESS THE SCHOOL AND OTHER EMPLOYMENT/SERVICE SITES. IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION FOR THE DISABLED POPULATION IT IS EXPECTED THAT ABLE-BODIED COMMUTERS COULD ALSO UTILIZE THIS SHUTTLE SERVICE TO REACH EMPLOYMENT IN THE AREA. ONE SHUTTLE LINKS THE EXTENSIVE BUS SERVICE ON THE RT. 3 CORRIDOR WITH THE LYNDHURST CAMPUS OF BERGEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE (THE REGIONAL CENTER) AS WELL AS WITH OTHER EMPLOYMENT SITES IN THE MEADOWLANDS CORPORATE CENTER WHERE THE COLLEGE IS LOCATED. ANOTHER SHUTTLE LINKS RAIL COMMUTERS COMING FROM RUTHERFORD (ALONG THE MAIN-BERGEN RAIL LINE) WOOD-RIDGE (ALONG THE PASCACK VALLEY RAIL LINE) AND/OR SECAUCUS JUNCTION (A TRANSFER STATION OFFERING CONNECTIONS TO ALMOST ALL OF NJ TRANSITS RAIL LINES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE RARITAN VALLEY RAIL LINE AND THE ATLANTIC CITY RAIL LINE) TO THE LYNDHURST BERGEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE SITE AS WELL AS TO RTS. 17 120 EMPLOYMENT CORRIDORS IN CARLSTADT AND MOONACHIE. OATS PROVIDES SERVICES IN RURAL MISSOURI SMALL URBAN MISSOURI AND URBAN MISSOURI. FOR THIS GRANT OATS HAS TWO APPLICATIONS ONE FOR RURAL MISSOURI AND ONE FOR THE SMALL URBAN AREA. FOR THE RURAL MISSOURI PORTION OF THEIR PROJECT OATS IS ASKING FOR CAPITAL ASSISTANCE ONLY. FOR THIS PROJECT OATS IS ASKING FOR 6 VEHICLES WITH A LIFT THAT WILL HANDLE OVER 800 POUNDS. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION ISSUES IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE STATE OF MISSOURI. THE RURAL PROJECT FOR OATS WENT INTO SERVICE IN MARCH 2009 AS THE NEED WAS IDENTIFIED THROUGH THE REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION. THE THREE COUNTIES THAT THIS PROJECT SERVES PROVIDES THE LOCAL MATCH FOR OPERATING. FOR THE SMALL URBAN AREA OATS IS ASKING FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND WILL BE PROVIDING JOB TRIPS FROM THE SMALL URBAN TO THE RURAL AREAS TO OPEN UP COMMUNITY INTEGRATION FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS THAT NEED ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION. MOST OF THESE TRIPS WILL BE IN THE SURROUNDING COLUMBIA AREA BUT SOME WILL BE IN JOPLIN AREA AS WELL. THIS PROJECT IS NEW AND WENT INTO SERVICE IN OCTOBER 2009. THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES PROVIDE THE LOCAL MATCH FOR THIS PROJECT. THESE VEHICLES WILL HAVE A LIFT THAT CAN PROVIDE UP TO 800 POUNDS. THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE GRANT WILL BE USED TO FUND A NEW PROGRAM DESIGNED TO GET PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES TO WORK WITHIN THE JACKSON COUNTY BOUNDARIES. THIS PROJECT WENT INTO SERVICE IN APRIL 2008. THIS GOES ABOVE AND BEYOND THE ADA REQUIREMENTS BECAUSE THERE WAS NO SERVICE IN PLACE AT THIS TIME.MONITEAU COUNTY SENATE BILL 40 BOARD IS REQUESTING 3 VEHICLES UNDER THE CAPITAL ASSISTANCE PORTION OF THE GRANT AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE AS WELL. SRTA IS REQUESTING $42528 (FY 12) OF 5317 NEW FREEDOM FEDERAL FUNDS PROVIDENCE-RI-MA UZA 250310 FOR FIRST YEAR OPERATING EXPENSES FOR MANY-TO-FEW DEMAND RESPONSE LONG DISTANCE TRANSPORTATION FOR ADA ELIGIBLE PASSENGERS TO MEDICAL TREATMENT FACILITIES THAT ARE BEYOND SRTAS SERVICE AREA. SRTA WILL DETERMINE ADA ELIGIBILITY OF PASSENGERS TO ACCESS THIS SERVICE. THIS NEED OUTSIDE OF THE SRTA SERVICE AREA IS MOST DIFFICULT TO MEET FOR ONGOING MEDICAL CARE SUCH AS DIALYSIS RADIATION AND CHEMOTHERAPY. MANY MEDICAL FACILITIES THAT ARE USED BY AREA RESIDENTS ARE LOCATED IN AREAS THAT HAVE ZERO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ACCESS YET THE TRANSPORTATION NEED REMAINS SIGNIFICANT AND IS GROWING. SERVICE WILL INCLUDE 2 WEEKLY ROUND TRIP SERVICE TO MEDICAL FACILITIES AND WILL TARGET RIDERS FROM THE PORTION OF SRTAS SERVICE DISTRICT IN THE PROVIDENCE RI-MA URBANIZED AREA WHO SEEK ACCESS TO MEDICAL FACILITIES IN THE BOSTON URBANIZED AREA. LOCAL MATCH WILL BE COME FROM MASSDOT STATE CONTRACT ASSISTANCE. THIS PROJECT WAS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED.SRTA PROVIDES 24 FIXED ROUTE BUS ROUTES IN THE SERVICE AREA AS WELL AS DEMAND-RESPONSE SERVICE TO SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. SRTA SIGNED THE FY13 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES IN TEAM ON MARCH 28 2013 AND IS UNDER CONDITIONAL APPROVAL FOR CIVIL RIGHTS SUBMISSIONS INCLUDING TITLE VI.SRTA WAS DESIGNATED BY MA GOVERNOR PATRICK AS 1 OF 2 DESIGNATED RECIPIENTS FOR JARC AND NEW FREEDOM FUNDS FOR THE MA PORTION OF THE PROVIDENCE RI MA UZA. A SPLIT AGREEMENT WITH RIDOT RIPTA AND SRTA FOR FY12 PROVIDENCE UZA FUNDING WAS EXECUTED IN 2012 AND THE SPLIT LETTER IS ATTACHED. SERVICES WILL INCLUDE THE PROVIDENCE MA URBANIZED AREA AND IS LOCATED IN MA CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICT #3.

THIS NEW FREEDOM GRANT FOR THE GREATER LAFAYETTE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CORPORATION (CITYBUS) CONSISTS OF TWO FISCAL YEAR FUNDING SOURCES: 1)FY2012 SECTION 5317 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $22716 FOR A PERIOD COVERING THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT FROM JANUARY 2012-DECEMBER 2013. 2) FY2011 FY2012 SECTION 5317 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $870202 FOR A PERIOD COVERING THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT FROM AUGUST 2013-OCTOBER 2014. $352774 IN LAPSING FY2011 FUNDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION.THE PROJECT FUNDED USING FY2012 SECTION 5317 FUNDS IS A TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM. DES #1298084NEW FREEDOM FUNDS WERE USED TO EXPAND CITYBUS TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM TO A FULL-TIME PROGRAM DUE TO INCREASED DEMAND IN JANUARY 2011. PRIOR THE PROGRAM HAD BEEN OPERATED ON A PART TIME BASIS SINCE THE PROGRAMS INCEPTION IN AUGUST 2009. TRAVEL TRAINING SERVICES ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL RIDERS BUT ARE TARGETED SPECIFICALLY THROUGH MARKETING AND OUTREACH EFFORTS TO PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIOR CITIZENS. THE MUCH-NEEDED PROGRAM HAS CONTINUED TO GROW SINCE EXPANDING TO A FULL-TIME PROGRAM IN 2010. ADDITIONAL TARGETED OUTREACH TO ADA-ELIGIBLE RIDERS WAS IMPLEMENTED IN 2011 TO MAINSTREAM RIDERS FROM PARATRANSIT TO REGULAR ROUTE SERVICES WHEN POSSIBLE. THE GRANT FUNDS ARE USED TOWARD THE SALARY AND COMPENSATION COSTS FOR ONE FULL-TIME POSITION TO COORDINATE AND CONDUCT THE TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM.THE PROJECTS FUNDED USING FY2011 FY2012 SECTION 5317 FUNDS INCLUDE:--CONSTRUCTION OF ADA RAMPS $710202 (DES #1382674)--ENGINEERING FOR RAMP CONSTRUCTION $80000 (DES #1382674)--PURCHASE ADP HARDWARE/SOFTWARE UPGRADES $80000 (DES #1382673)CITYBUS AND THE CITY OF LAFAYETTE ARE SEEKING NEW FREEDOM FUNDS TO CONSTRUCT ACCESSIBLE RAMPS ON BOTH SIDES OF THE RAIL CORRIDOR NEAR THE ELEVATORS. ELEVATORS ON EITHER SIDE OF THE RAIL CORRIDOR AT THE JAMES RIEHLE DEPOT PLAZA ALLOW PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO ACCESS THE BRIDGE OVER THE RAILROAD TRACKS AND THE AMTRAK BOARDING PLATFORM. EVEN WITH CONTINUAL MAINTENANCE THESE ELEVATORS DO BREAK DOWN. THE NEW FREEDOM FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ENGINEERING WORK COMPLETING ALL OF THE NECESSARY NEPA DOCUMENTATION AND FOR CONSTRUCTION.CITYBUS CONTINUALLY STRIVES TO IMPROVE AND GO ABOVE AND BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT. THE AVL (AUTOMATIC VEHICLE LOCATION) EQUIPMENT AND RELATED SOFTWARE CURRENTLY USED BY THE DEMAND RESPONSE OPERATION (ACCESS) IS APPROACHING TECHNICAL OBSOLESCENCE. CITYBUS IS SEEKING NEW FREEDOM FUNDS TO PURCHASE DEMAND RESPONSE HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE UPGRADES. FURTHER IVR (INTERACTIVE VOICE RESPONSE) TECHNOLOGY UPGRADES ARE PLANNED TO INCREASE CUSTOMER RELIABILITY.PROJECTS FROM BOTH FISCAL YEARS ARE LISTED IN THE ATTACHED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) AND WERE SELECTED PURSUANT TO A COMPLETED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. A PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN (PMP) HAS BEEN APPROVED BY FTA.CITYBUS PROVIDES THE OPPORTUNITY FOR THE PUBLIC TO REVIEW AND COORDINATED THE PLAN THROUGH THE TIPPECANOE COUNTY AREA PLAN COMMISSION. THE AREA PLAN COMMISSION CREATES THE TIP WHICH INCLUDES THE COORDINATED PLAN FOR CITYBUS.CITYBUS WILL USE LOCAL PROPERTY TAXES AND PROGRAM REVENUE TO SUPPORT THE LOCAL PARTICIPATION IN THIS GRANT. THE SOUTH FLORIDA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY IS APPLYING FOR THE FY 2012 SECTION 5317 NEW FREEDOM (NF) FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2084771. THE FY 2012 OPERATING PROJECTS TOTAL $1290895 AND THE CAPITAL PROJECTS TOTAL $793876. THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) WAS COMPETITIVELY SELECTED FROM THE TRANSPORTATION DISADVANTAGE SERVICES PLAN (TDSP)/ HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS (HSTP) FOR BROWARD MIAMI DADE AND PALM BEACH COUNTIES ACCORDING TO THE REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE NEW FREEDOM CIRCULAR. THE TDSPS AND HSTPS CAN BE FOUND ON THE SFRTA WEBSITE AT HTTP://WWW.SFRTA.FL.GOV/GRANTS.HTML. THE MATCH REQUIREMENT FOR EACH RECIPIENT WILL BE MADE IN CASH FOR THE OPERATING AND CAPITAL PROJECTS.IN PALM BEACH COUNTY THREE (3) PROJECTS WERE SELECTED: METRO TAXIS ACCESSIBLE TAXI PROGRAM WHICH WILL PROVIDE WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE MINIVANS TO DELIVER HIGH RESPONSIVE SERVICE TO LOCAL DISABLED AND AMBULATORY RIDERS. THE PROVIDER PROPOSES SAME DAY SERVICE 24 HOURS 365 DAYS PER YEAR TO ALL AREAS OF PALM BEACH COUNTY. GRANT FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO PURCHASE FIVE (5) WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE MINIVANS.THE VOLEN CENTERS PROJECT IS A CONTINUATION AND EXPANSION OF THEIR SAME-DAY ON-DEMAND TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR DISABLED AND ELDERLY PERSONS IN PALM BEACH COUNTY. THE SERVICE HOURS AND SERVICE AREA WILL BE EXPANDED. ALSO THE VOLEN CENTER IS CONTINUING THE COMMUNITY MOBILITY MANAGER PROGRAM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE COMMUNITY MOBILITY MANAGER WILL BE TO CONTINUE DESIGNING TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH MENTAL AND PHYSICAL DISABILITIES WITH AN EMPHASIS ON SENIORS. THE MOBILITY MANAGER WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND LOCAL CITY AND COUNTY GOVERNMENTS. RUTH RALES JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE WILL PROVIDE A COMMUNITY CENTER VAN ACCESS (CCVA) PROGRAM WHICH WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND LOW-INCOME SENIORS. RUTH RALES WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDS TO PURCHASE TWO (2) ADA COMPLIANT VANS AND OPERATE THE ROUTES. IN BROWARD COUNTY THE PROJECT SELECTED: THE CITY OF FORT LAUDERDALE WILL UTILIZE GRANT DOLLARS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR TWO ROUTES AND FOR A MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CONSULTANT. IN MIAMI DADE COUNTY THE PROJECT SELECTED:ZUNI TRANSPORTATIONS SOUTH DADE NEW FREEDOM SERVICE. THE GRANT WILL BE UTILIZED TO PURCHASE EIGHT (8) WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES TO PROVIDE ON-DEMAND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR DISABLED AND ELDERLY PERSONS.REGIONAL PROJECT:PEARL TRANSIT CORP WILL UTILIZE GRANT DOLLARS TO IMPLEMENT THEIR WAY2WORK PROGRAM WHICH WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND TRAVEL TRAINING SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES LIVING IN BROWARD PALM BEACH AND MIAMI-DADE COUNTIES. COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS - THE SOUTH FLORIDA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION IN BROWARD MIAMI-DADE AND PALM BEACH COUNTIES ANNOUNCED A CALL FOR PROJECTS IN THE MIAMI URBANIZED AREA FOR JOB ACCESS REVERSE COMMUTE AND NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM FUNDS FOR FISCAL YEAR 2012. THE APPLICATION FORM AS WELL AS DETAILS CONCERNING SPECIFIC ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS LOCAL SHARE REQUIREMENTS AND ALLOWABLE ACTIVITIES WERE INCLUDED IN THE MIAMI URBANIZED AREA JARC NEW FREEDOM APPLICATION PACKAGE AND MADE AVAILABLE ONLINE THE WEEK OCTOBER 15 2012 AT WW.SFRTA.FL.GOV/GRANTS.HTML. THE APPLICATION DEADLINE WAS FEBRUARY 1 2013 AT 12 P.M. APPLICATIONS FOUND TO BE INCOMPLETE OR RECEIVED AFTER 12 P.M. ON FEBRUARY 1 2013 WERE NOT CONSIDERED FOR FUNDING. COMPLETED APPLICATIONS WERE SUBMITTED IN PERSON TO THE SFRTA AT 800 NW 33RD STREET POMPANO BEACH FL 33064. AFTER INITIAL SCREENING OF APPLICATION BY SFRTA STAFF TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY AND COMPLETENESS THE SFRTAS PLANNING AND TECHNICAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE (PTAC) WHICH CONSISTS OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM LOCAL TRANSIT TRANSPORTATION AND SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCIES EVALUATED THE APPLICATIONS. THE RANKED PROJECTS WERE THEN SUBMITTED TO THE SFRTA GOVERNING BOARD FOR APPROVAL AT THEIR REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETING ON JUNE 7 2013. THE SFRTA GOVERNING BOARD APPROVED THE PTAC EVALUATIONS AND RECOMMENDED THE PROJECTS BE SUBMITTED TO THE FTA.

FY 2011 FY 2012 NEW FREEDOM GRANT #FL-57-X037-00:THE JACKSONVILLE TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY SERVING AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR THE JACKSONVILLE URBANIZED AREA IS APPLYING FOR THE FULL COMBINED FY 2011 APPORTIONMENT AMOUNT OF $335463 AND THE FY 2012 APPORTIONMENT AMOUNT OF $339363 FOR A TOTAL OF $674826; AND THIS APPLICATION WILL COMBINE LOCAL FUNDING FROM FY 2011 FOR $203210 AND LOCAL FUNDING FROM FY 2012 FOR $249661 FOR A TOTAL LOCAL PROJECT AMOUNT FOR THE TWO FISCAL YEARS OF $452871; FOR THE FULL PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1127697 IN ORDER TO FULLY OBLIGATE ALL SECTION 5317 NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM FUNDS FOR THE JACKSONVILLE UZA FROM FY 2011 THROUGH FY 2012.THIS APPLICATION FOR FY 2011 AND FY 2012 NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM FUNDS WILL EQUAL $674826 IN FTA FUNDS ALONG WITH $452871 IN LOCAL FUNDS FOR A TOTAL PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1127697.THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DERIVED FROM A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. THIS NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN WAS DEVELOPED THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE NON-PROFIT AND HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND PARTICIPATION BY THE PUBLIC. ALL RELEVANT DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED TO TEAM SYSTEM AND THIS PLAN IS AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING ON THE JTA WEBSITE AT THE FOLLOWING LOCATION:HTTP://WWW.JTAFLA.COM/PDF/COORDINATED%20MOBILITY%20PLAN/FINAL%20COORDINATED%20PLAN%2008.PDFTHESE PROJECTS FOR THIS TWO YEAR PROGRAM OF PROJECTS WERE SELECTED AS THE RESULT OF AREA-WIDE COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESSES WITH THE FIRST PERIOD OF FUNDING AVAILABILITY STARTED IN DECEMBER OF 2011 AND THESE TWO SOLICITATIONS WERE COMPLETED ON MARCH 08 2012 AND MAY 15 2012 WITH FY 2011 FUNDING AWARDED IN THE AMOUNT OF $332756 WITH A CARRYOVER TO THE NEXT SOLICITATION PERIOD OF $2707. THE NEXT SOLICITATION PROCESS STARTED IN DECEMBER OF 2012 AND ENDED ON MARCH 05 2013 FOR THE REMAINING FY 2011 CARRYOVER FUNDING OF $2707 AND FY 2012 FUNDING OF $339363 WITH BOTH AMOUNTS BEING AWARDED FOR A COMBINED AMOUNT OF $342070; THIS RESULTED IN A TWO YEAR AWARDED FEDERAL TOTAL OF $674826.THE FOCUS OF THESE PROGRAMS IS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TOOLS TO OVERCOME EXISTING BARRIERS FACING AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES SEEKING INTEGRATION INTO THE WORK FORCE AND FULL PARTICIPATION IN SOCIETY. LACK OF ADEQUATE TRANSPORTATION IS A PRIMARY BARRIER TO WORK FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE 2000 CENSUS SHOWED THAT ONLY 60 PERCENT OF PEOPLE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 16 AND 64 WITH DISABILITIES ARE EMPLOYED. THE NEW FREEDOM FORMULA GRANT PROGRAM SEEKS TO REDUCE BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPAND THE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ADA ACT OF 1990.THE FIRST PROJECT FUNDED UNDER THIS APPROPRIATION WILL INCLUDE FUNDING TO THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT (JTA) FOR ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS (UP TO 10%) FOR UPDATES TO THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN GRANT AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OF JTA AND SUB-RECIPIENT PROJECTS WITH $67482 ($33546 FROM FY 2011 AND $$33936 FROM FY 2012) OVER THE TWO YEAR PROJECT FUNDING PERIOD. #8195;THE SECOND PROJECT THAT WAS AWARDED WITH TWO YEARS OF PROJECT FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $208963 ($128000 FROM FY 2011 AND $77963 FROM FY 2012) TO THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT (JTA) WAS FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE FRAMEWORK AND PROCESSES FOR THE REGIONAL MOBILITY OPTIONS CAPITAL PROGRAM; LEVERAGE ADDITIONAL FUNDING SOURCES FOR ACQUIRING AND EXPANDING TECHNOLOGICAL TOOLS TRAINING STAFF; AND EDUCATING PASSENGERS AND PARTNERING AGENCIES ON THE TRANSPORTATION RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO THEM. THIS PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES UPDATING THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE STRATEGIC GOAL OF THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN BY INVESTING IN COORDINATED SEAMLESS TRANSPORTATION ACROSS JURISDICTIONAL BOUNDARIES AND/OR BETWEEN SERVICES AND TO ENHANCE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AVAILABILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE TECHNOLOGY COMPONENTS OF THE ONE CALL/ONE CLICK TRANSPORTATION RESOURCE CENTER AND THE REGIONAL SCHEDULING SYSTEM PROJECTS.THE THIRD PROJECT THAT WAS AWARDED WITH TWO YEARS OF PROJECT FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $230210 ($110210 FROM FY 2011 AND $120000 FROM FY 2012) TO THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT (JTA) WAS FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE FRAMEWORK AND PROCESSES FOR THE REGIONAL MOBILITY OPTIONS OPERATIONAL PROGRAM; TO EDUCATE AND INFORM THE COMMUNITY OF ALL AVAILABLE MOBILITY OPTIONS THROUGH A TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM IN CONJUNCTION WITH AND IN PARTNERSHIP WITH ELDERSOURCE. THIS IS A MULTIFACETED PROGRAM THAT FACILITATES COORDINATION AMONG TRANSPORTATION SERVICE PROVIDERS ACROSS THE REGION TO SYNCHRONIZE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND INFORMATION. MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WILL IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION FOR PROVIDERS AND PASSENGERS AND THUS INCREASE OPERATING EFFICIENCY AND SERVICE BEYOND WHAT IS REQUIRED BY THE ADA. IMPROVEMENTS IN SERVICE MAY INCLUDE SEAMLESS TRAVEL THROUGHOUT THE REGION INCREASED FREQUENCY AND HOURS OF OPERATION NEW SERVICE AND AN EXPANDED SERVICE AREA. SUB-RECIPIENT FUNDING PROJECTS (EXCLUDING JTA):1) CLAY COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING (CCCOA) - THIS APPROPRIATION IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $121653 ($61000 FROM FY 2011 AND $60653 FROM FY 2012) IS TO AUGMENT THE NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM THAT WAS STARTED BY THE CCCOA IN FY 2009 AND THESE SERVICES WERE NOT IN OPERATION PRIOR TO AUGUST OF 2005 AND WAS NOT AVAILABLE IN CLAY COUNTY AND IS BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ADA. THE CURRENT SERVICES INCLUDE THE CONTINUED OPERATIONS OF THE NF SERVICE ROUTE FROM GREEN COVE SPRINGS THROUGH ORANGE PARK TO NAS JAX AND ON TO EVEREST COLLEGE AND TARGET WHERE THE DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED WORKERS ARE EMPLOYED.2) CLAY COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING (CCCOA) - THIS APPROPRIATION IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $49518 ($49518 FROM FY 2012 ONLY) IS TO AUGMENT THE NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM THAT WAS STARTED BY THE CCCOA IN FY 2009 AND THESE SERVICES WERE NOT IN OPERATION PRIOR TO AUGUST OF 2005 AND WAS NOT AVAILABLE IN CLAY COUNTY AND IS BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ADA. THE CURRENT SERVICES INCLUDE THE CONTINUED OPERATIONS OF THE NF SERVICE ROUTE THAT BEGINS IN MIDDLEBURG AND ENDS AT THE CLAY COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT AT BEAR RUN.THE JTA WILL NEGOTIATE SUB-AWARD AGREEMENTS WITH ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS AND THESE SUB-AWARD AGREEMENTS WHEN EXECUTED WILL BE ATTACHED TO THE GRANT FOR VIEWING BY THE FTA. AMENDMENT #1 (FY 2010 JARC GRANT #FL-57-X022-01):THE JACKSONVILLE TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY SERVING AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR THE JACKSONVILLE URBANIZED AREA IS APPLYING FOR THE FULL FY 2010 APPORTIONMENT AMOUNT OF $333740; AND THIS APPLICATION WILL COMBINE LOCAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $225614 FOR AN ADDITIONAL PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IN THE AMOUNT OF $559354 IN ORDER TO FULLY OBLIGATE ALL SECTION 5317 NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM FUNDS FOR THE JACKSONVILLE UZA THROUGH FY 2010.THIS AMENDED APPLICATION FOR FY 2010 NF FUNDS WILL COMBINE FY 2009 NF FUNDING AND WILL EQUAL $673791 IN FTA FUNDS ALONG WITH $531660 IN LOCAL FUNDS FOR A TOTAL AMENDED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS TOTALING $1205451.THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DERIVED FROM A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. THIS NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN WAS DEVELOPED THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE NON-PROFIT AND HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND PARTICIPATION BY THE PUBLIC. ALL RELEVANT DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED TO TEAM SYSTEM AND THIS PLAN IS AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING ON THE JTA WEBSITE AT THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS:HTTP://WWW.JTAFLA.COM/PDF/COORDINATED%20MOBILITY%20PLAN/FINAL%20COORDINATED%20PLAN%2008.PDFTHESE PROJECTS WERE SELECTED AS THE RESULT OF AN AREA-WIDE COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS THAT WAS STARTED IN DECEMBER OF 2010 AND WAS COMPLETED ON MARCH 10 2011. THE FOCUS OF THESE PROGRAMS IS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TOOLS TO OVERCOME EXISTING BARRIERS FACING AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES SEEKING INTEGRATION INTO THE WORK FORCE AND FULL PARTICIPATION IN SOCIETY. LACK OF ADEQUATE TRANSPORTATION IS A PRIMARY BARRIER TO WORK FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE 2000 CENSUS SHOWED THAT ONLY 60 PERCENT OF PEOPLE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 16 AND 64 WITH DISABILITIES ARE EMPLOYED. THE NEW FREEDOM FORMULA GRANT PROGRAM SEEKS TO REDUCE BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPAND THE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ADA ACT OF 1990.PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE FUNDING TO THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT (JTA) FOR ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS (UP TO 10%) FOR UPDATES TO THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN GRANT AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OF JTA AND SUB-RECIPIENT PROJECTS WITH $33374 IN AMENDED PROJECT FUNDING. THE SECOND PROJECT THAT WAS AWARDED AMENDED FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $99670 TO THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT (JTA) WAS FOR THE CONTINUATION OF A MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AND TOOLS WILL BE DESIGNED TO BE USED BY EVERY CTC IN THE REGION AND ADDITIONAL PARTNERS AS APPROPRIATE. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE STRATEGIC GOAL OF THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN BY INVESTING IN COORDINATED SEAMLESS TRANSPORTATION ACROSS JURISDICTIONAL BOUNDARIES AND/OR BETWEEN SERVICES AND TO ENHANCE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AVAILABILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE RESEARCH INTO BEST PRACTICES AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROCESSES AND STANDARDS FOR A SHARED MULTICOUNTY SCHEDULING AND EQUITABLE REGIONAL FARE COLLECTION SYSTEMS TO MAKE IT EASIER FOR A RIDER TO PAY FOR REGIONAL TRAVEL AND BETWEEN TRANSPORTATION MODES. MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CAN ADDRESS AND SOLVE MANY TRANSPORTATION CHALLENGES AND PROBLEMS FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WILL IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION FOR PROVIDERS AND PASSENGERS AND THUS INCREASE OPERATING EFFICIENCY AND SERVICE BEYOND WHAT IS REQUIRED BY THE ADA. IMPROVEMENTS IN SERVICE MAY INCLUDE SEAMLESS TRAVEL THROUGHOUT THE REGION INCREASED FREQUENCY AND HOURS OF OPERATION NEW SERVICE AND AN EXPANDED SERVICE AREA. TECHNOLOGY RELATED TO MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CAN ALSO IMPROVE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND ASSIST INDIVIDUALS WITH THEIR TRAVEL NEEDS AND LIMITATIONS.SUB-RECIPIENT FUNDING PROJECTS (EXCLUDING JTA):1) THE ARC JACKSONVILLE - THIS IS TO CONTINUE A PROJECT THAT BEGAN IN OCTOBER OF 2009 FOR SERVICE THAT WAS NOT IN OPERATION PRIOR TO AUGUST OF 2005 AND IS BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ADA. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SERVICE TO ARC CLIENTS AND WILL MAXIMIZE TRANSPORTATION THROUGH A COOPERATIVE AND COORDINATED EFFORT AS WELL AS OTHER INDIVIDUALS AS COORDINATED THROUGH JTA CONNEXION IN DUVAL CLAY AND BAKER COUNTIES. THE ARC JACKSONVILLE WILL PROVIDE GROUP TRIPS TO INDIVIDUALS WITH A DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY TO VOCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAMS AND COMMUNITY EMPLOYMENT. THIS TRANSPORTATION SERVICE WILL INCLUDE GROUPING PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS AND COORDINATING SERVICES WITH EACH COMMUNITY PROGRAM PROVIDER SO THAT THE NEAREST SERVICE CENTER IS USED AND REDUCES OVERALL TRANSPORTATION COSTS. THE FOCUS OF THESE PROGRAMS IS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TOOLS TO OVERCOME EXISTING BARRIERS FACING AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES SEEKING INTEGRATION INTO THE WORK FORCE AND FULL PARTICIPATION IN SOCIETY. LACK OF ADEQUATE TRANSPORTATION IS A PRIMARY BARRIER TO WORK FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE 2000 CENSUS SHOWED THAT ONLY 60 PERCENT OF PEOPLE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 16 AND 64 WITH DISABILITIES ARE EMPLOYED. THE NEW FREEDOM FORMULA GRANT PROGRAM SEEKS TO REDUCE BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPAND THE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES BEYOND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ADA ACT OF 1990.PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE FUNDING TO THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT (JTA) FOR ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS (UP TO 10%) FOR UPDATES TO THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA COORDINATED MOBILITY PLAN GRANT AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OF JTA AND SUB-RECIPIENT PROJECTS; AND ONE PROJECT THAT WAS AWARDED BY THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA MOBILITY COALITION COMPETITIVE SELECTION COMMITTEE TO THE JTA FOR A TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM.THE TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM PROJECT THAT WAS AWARDED FUNDING TO THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT (JTA) WILL IMPACT THE ENTIRE FIVE COUNTY REGION AS WELL AS VOLUSIA AND FLAGLER COUNTIES AS THE JTA IS PARTNERING WITH ELDER SOURCE WHICH SERVES THE ENTIRE REGION.THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAMS TO ENCOURAGE PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES SENIOR ADULTS AND PERSONS OF LOW INCOME TO USE LOWER COST TRIP OPTIONS. THE PROGRAM WILL BEGIN WITH TRAIN-THE-TRAINER TO PROVIDE NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED EASTER SEALS PROJECT ACTION MODELS AND PROCEDURES TO THOSE WHO WILL PROVIDE DIRECT TRAINING TO INDIVIDUALS. IN THIS MANNER THE TRAINING ALSO PROVIDES RIDER AND PROVIDER UNDERSTANDING OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICE OPTIONS AVAILABLE. TRAINING PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIORS TO USE FIXED ROUTE BUS SERVICE WILL PROVIDE EACH INDIVIDUAL WITH THE KNOWLEDGE TO GAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE. THIS TRAINING WILL ALLOW STUDENTS TO USE THE ACCOMMODATIONS PROVIDED THROUGH FIXED ROUTE SERVICE ALLOWING THEM THE FREEDOM TO TRAVEL WHEN AND WHERE THEY WANT TO GO WITHOUT DEPENDING UPON PARATRANSIT SERVICE WHICH MUST BE SCHEDULED AHEAD OF TIME AND COSTS ARE HIGHER FOR THE RIDER.TRAVEL INSTRUCTION (ALSO KNOWN AS TRAVEL TRAINING) WILL BE ONE-TO-ONE INSTRUCTION DESIGNED TO TEACH PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIORS TO TRAVEL SAFELY AND INDEPENDENTLY ON FIXED-ROUTE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THEIR COMMUNITY.
